en:
Found in 1956 at Ullastret, Camp alt V. Sugrera, Carrer 1 Sitja,
      13/7.

Goose or swan, standing profile to the right (only head preserved); Chryse (labelled), standing near frontal, slightly to the left, with her weight on her right leg, and her left knee bent, wearing a belted peplos, a sphendone, black necklace, dotted-hoop earrings, and a black band on each wrist, looks down at the bird, and holds her right hand just above the bird, and holds her left arm down and back; Eunomia (labelled), standing 3/4-view to the left, wearing a belted, sleeved chiton with a kolpos, a white taenia, a short pony tail, black hoop earrings, a black necklace, and black bands on each wrist, holds a flower (?) in her left hand, at waist level, and a beaded necklace (?) in her upraised right hand; Eukleia (labelled), standing profile to the right, wearing a belted peplos, a sphendone with a wreath, a black necklace, black leaf-shaped earrings, and a black band on each wrist, raises her left foot on a rock, and holding a necklace between her upraised right hand and her lowered left hand, to a female figure, perhaps Nikopolis (labelled); a small deer (?) moving profile to the right; "Nikopolis" seated near profile to the right, head profile to the left, wearing a belted peplos, a black necklace, a sphendone with a wreath, and a black (?) band on her right wrist, rests her right hand on a rock, and her left hand on her lap; a laurel (?) branch.

The name of the fourth female figure has been alternatively read as Nike, Aike, Dike, or Nikopolis.
Pres. H. 0.143 m; max. diam. (est.) 0.28 m

<bibl>Shapiro 1993</bibl>, 73-74, 237 no. 28, fig. 25;
      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 3.389 s.v. Dike no. 4 (H.A. Shapiro), 281 s.v. Chryse 2 no. 2
      (H. Froning); <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 4.50 s.v. Eukleia no. 7, pl. 23 (A.
      Kossatz-Deissmann), 64 s.v. Eunomia no. 9 (A. Kossatz-Deissmann); <bibl>Burn
      1987</bibl>, pl. 19b; E. Sanmart and J. Barbera, <hi rend="ital">Arte griego en
      Espana</hi> (Barcelona 1987) 115, fig. 148; J. Maluquer de Motes i Nicolau et al.,
      <hi rend="ital">CVA, Muse Monographique d'Ullastret</hi> 1 (1984) 36-37, pl. 34.1;
      R. Olmos and M. Picazo, "Zum Handel mit griechischen Vasen und Bronzen auf der Iberischen
      Halbinsel," <bibl>MM</bibl> 20 (1979) pl. 28b; M. Picazo, <hi
      rend="ital">Las cermicas ticas de Ullastret</hi> (Barcelona 1977) no. 231, pl. 22.1;
      P. Pericay, "La escena femenina con nombres e deidades en un fragmento de cermica griega de
      Ullastret (Gerona)," <hi rend="ital">Miscelanea Arqueologica</hi> 2 (Barcelona
      1974) 165-72.
